article.description: Remond Brown had 17 points and seven rebounds, Ervin Mitchell scored 15 and Grambling pulled away to beat Arkansas-Pine Bluff 61-53 on Saturday night.
article.headline: Grambling State beats Arkansas-Pine Bluff 61-53
article.story: GRAMBLING, La. -- Remond Brown had 17 points and seven rebounds, Ervin Mitchell scored 15 and Grambling pulled away to beat Arkansas-Pine Bluff 61-53 on Saturday night. The Tigers (9-12, 4-4 Southwestern Athletic Conference) had an 11-0 run to lead 60-48 on Chase Cormier's 3-pointer with 2:04 left. The Golden Lions (5-17, 4-4) led for a 4 1/2-minute stretch in the middle of the second half. Nigel Ribeiro added 10 points and Avery Ugba had seven points and 11 rebounds for Grambling, which won its second straight. Trent Steen had 13 points to lead Pine Bluff, which outrebounded the Tigers 38-32 but had 25 turnovers compared to Grambling's 15. The Lions started the game with a 6-2 run before Grambling took control five minutes in and led the rest of the half. In the second half, Pine Bluff had a 9-0 run to take a 31-28 lead with 12:16 left.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.
